The inverse is not logically equivalent to the original statement. The only forms that are logically equivalent to the original conditional statement are the contrapositive and the converse. The contrapositive of "If P, then Q" is "If not Q, then not P" (¬Q → ¬P), which is logically equivalent to the original statement.
